title: (x) Valentino logo w/ sharp tiny serifs - Arrow {Mike Y}
content:
Another question about a fashion type without scan (sorry;-)  
Is the Valentino logo custom made or an existing typeface?

Stefan
author: Stefan Seifert

comments.content:
I guess this is what you’re talking about:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150324002756im_/http:/typophile.com/files/val-2_3513.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150324002756im_/http:/typophile.com/files/val_4673.gif)

If that's the logo, the font looks like [Arrow](http://web.archive.org/web/20150324002756/http:/www.treacyfaces.com/050806_TFArrow_2c5a.html), in the book or light weight. Possibly the middle serif on the E has been removed.

- Mike Yanega

First of all, thanks Florian for the image.  
It is the one.  
And thanks, Mike!  
Seems to be a worthwhile trace, yet, on the link you gave I found only the ultrabold version.  
Tried to search for it on fontshop without success and stopped after a while in Google for thousands of symbol types came out for the arrow. I am too stupid for good searching.  
In any case I think something was done with a standard font, yet, changed a bit.

Thanks so far  
Stefan

Great Mike F!!

Hey Mike Y,

think you came pretty close!  
I believe they used it.  
Who did it? ;-)

Thanks guys, great help!!  
I am proud of you all at typophile!

Stefan

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150324002756im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Bild-1_6586.gif)
